page.title: 16TREFRIFAWR FARM ABERDYFI
page.content: As we walked through the farmyard gate the first thing that struck me was the rather quaint grey stone farmhouse.It was double fronted with two chimneys.The farmyard was fascinating;free range chickens ran about,a sheepdog lay silently watching every move,orphaned lambs were in a small enclosure and noisy geese paraded near their pond.It was interesting to see that a shallow part of the pond had been set aside for newts and frogs.Mr.Roberts,the farmer,explained that he had always been fascinated by these small creatures.The farmer sheared a sheep for us.I was surprised to see his hands dripping with greese from the fleece and to hear that it would earn only Â£1/Â£1.50.I thought Mr.Roberts was a very caring man.{Written by a 12 {year old boy after a visit to the farm
